info.title: Smart Rollup Node RPCs
info.description: Smart Rollup Node RPC API for protocol PtParisA6ruu136piHaBC7cQLDP87JEqtczJWP2pLa5QCELGBH5

get.description: RPCs documentation and input/output schema

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Layer-2 block of the layer-2 chain with respect to a Layer 1 block identifier

level.description: Level of the block, corresponds to the level of the tezos block.

predecessor.description: Predecessor hash of the Tezos block.

commitment_hash.description: Hash of this block's commitment if any was computed for it.

previous_commitment_hash.description: Previous commitment hash in the chain. If there is a commitment for this block, this field contains the commitment that was previously computed.

context.description: Hash of the layer 2 context for this block.

inbox_witness.description: Witness for the inbox for this block, i.e. the Merkle hash of payloads of messages.

inbox_hash.description: Hash of the inbox for this block.

messages.description: Messages added to the inbox in this block.

commitment.description: Commitment, if any is computed for this block.

initial_tick.description: Initial tick of the PVM at this block, i.e. before evaluation of the messages.

num_ticks.description: Number of ticks produced by the evaluation of the messages in this block.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Data availability processed slots and their statuses

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Availability slots for a given block

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Retrieve number of bytes in raw representation of value by key from PVM durable storage. PVM state is taken with respect to the specified block level.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Retrieve subkeys of the specified key from PVM durable storage. PVM state is taken with respect to the specified block level.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Retrieve value by key from PVM durable storage. PVM state is taken with respect to the specified block level. Value returned in hex format.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Tezos block hash of block known to the smart rollup node

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Generate serialized output proof for some outbox message

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Generate serialized output proof for some outbox message at level and index

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Rollup inbox for block

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Level of Tezos block known to the smart rollup node

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Number of messages for specified block

schema.description: Decimal representation of a big number
The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Outbox at block for a given outbox level

get.description: Outbox at block for a given outbox level

post.description: Simulate messages evaluation by the PVM

reveal_pages.description: Pages (at most 4kB) to be used for revelation ticks

insight_requests.description: Paths in the PVM to inspect after the simulation

oneOf.title: pvm_state
oneOf.description: Path in the PVM state

oneOf.title: durable_storage
oneOf.description: Path in the PVM durable storage

log_kernel_debug_file.description: File in which to emit kernel logs. This file will be created in <data-dir>/simulation_kernel_logs/, where <data-dir> is the data directory of the rollup node.

state_hash.description: Hash of the state after execution of the PVM on the input messages

status.description: Status of the PVM after evaluation

output.description: Output produced by evaluation of the messages

inbox_level.description: Level of the inbox that would contain these messages

num_ticks.description: Ticks taken by the PVM for evaluating the messages

insights.description: PVM state values requested after the simulation

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: State hash for this block

schema.title: The hash of the VM state of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: PVM status at block

schema.title: Universal string representation
schema.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.

get.description: Number of ticks for specified level

get.description: Total number of ticks at specified block

get.description: Monitor and streaming the L2 blocks

level.description: Level of the block, corresponds to the level of the tezos block.

commitment_hash.description: Hash of this block's commitment if any was computed for it.

previous_commitment_hash.description: Previous commitment hash in the chain. If there is a commitment for this block, this field contains the commitment that was previously computed.

context.description: Hash of the layer 2 context for this block.

inbox_witness.description: Witness for the inbox for this block, i.e. the Merkle hash of payloads of messages.

initial_tick.description: Initial tick of the PVM at this block, i.e. before evaluation of the messages.

post.description: Inject messages in the batcher's queue

schema.description: Messages to inject
Ids of injected L2 messages
The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: List messages present in the batcher's queue

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Retrieve an L2 message and its status

oneOf.title: unknown
oneOf.description: The message is not known by the batcher.

oneOf.title: pending_batch
oneOf.description: The message is in the batcher queue.

oneOf.title: pending_injection
oneOf.description: The message is batched but not injected yet.

oneOf.title: injected
oneOf.description: The message is injected as part of an L1 operation but it is not included in a block.

oneOf.title: included
oneOf.description: The message is included in an inbox in an L1 block.

oneOf.title: committed
oneOf.description: The message is included in a committed inbox on L1.

get.description: Wait for the node to have synchronized its L2 chain with the L1 chain, streaming its progress.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

017-PtNairob.contract_id.title: A contract handle
017-PtNairob.contract_id.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 implicit contract hash or a base58 originated contract hash.

017-PtNairob.contract_id.originated.title: A contract handle -- originated account
017-PtNairob.contract_id.originated.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 originated contract hash.

017-PtNairob.entrypoint.title: entrypoint
017-PtNairob.entrypoint.description: Named entrypoint to a Michelson smart contract

017-PtNairob.expressionKind.title: Expression kind
017-PtNairob.expressionKind.description: One of the four possible kinds of expression (integer, string, primitive application or sequence).

017-PtNairob.primitiveNamespace.title: Primitive namespace
017-PtNairob.primitiveNamespace.description: One of the five possible namespaces of primitive (data constructor, type name, instruction, keyword, or constant hash).

017-PtNairob.smart_rollup_address.title: A smart rollup address
017-PtNairob.smart_rollup_address.description: A smart rollup is identified by a base58 address starting with sr1

017-PtNairob.transaction_destination.title: A destination of a transaction
017-PtNairob.transaction_destination.description: A destination notation compatible with the contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 implicit contract hash, a base58 originated contract hash, a base58 originated transaction rollup, or a base58 originated smart rollup.

017-PtNairob.tx_rollup_id.title: A tx rollup handle
017-PtNairob.tx_rollup_id.description: A tx rollup notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts, is a base58 tx rollup hash

018-Proxford.primitiveNamespace.description: One of the five possible namespaces of primitive (data constructor, type name, instruction, keyword, or constant hash).

018-Proxford.transaction_destination.title: A destination of a transaction

Can be a base58 implicit contract hash, a base58 originated contract hash, a base58 originated transaction rollup, or a base58 originated smart rollup.

alpha.entrypoint.description: Named entrypoint to a Michelson smart contract

alpha.expressionKind.title: Expression kind

alpha.primitiveNamespace.title: Primitive namespace

bignum.title: Big number
bignum.description: Decimal representation of a big number

block_header.title: Block header
block_header.description: Block header. It contains both shell and protocol specific data.

block_locator.description: A sparse block locator  la Bitcoin

context_hash_version.description: A version number for the context hash computation

dal_skip_list_pointer.title: A hash that represents the skip list pointers (Base58Check-encoded)

distributed_db_version.description: A version number for the distributed DB protocol

distributed_db_version.name.description: A name for the distributed DB protocol

fitness.title: Block fitness
fitness.description: The fitness, or score, of a block, that allow the Tezos to decide which chain is the best. A fitness value is a list of byte sequences. They are compared as follows: shortest lists are smaller; lists of the same length are compared according to the lexicographical order.

history_mode.title: history mode
history_mode.description: Storage mode for the Tezos shell.

oneOf.title: archive
oneOf.description: Archive mode retains every block and operations since the genesis block including their metadata and their associated contexts.

oneOf.title: full
oneOf.description: Full mode retains every block and operations since the genesis block but periodically prunes older blocks' metadata to reduce the storage size.

additional_cycles.title: additional cycles
additional_cycles.description: Number of additional cycles preserved below the savepoint. By default: 1 additional cycles will be stored.

oneOf.title: rolling
oneOf.description: Rolling mode only retain the most recent cycles by periodically periodically discarding older blocks to reduce the storage size.

additional_cycles.title: additional cycles
additional_cycles.description: Number of additional cycles preserved below the savepoint. By default: 1 additional cycles will be stored.

oneOf.title: full_alias
oneOf.description: Full mode with default number of additional cycles.

oneOf.title: rolling_alias
oneOf.description: Rolling mode with default number of additional cycles.

oneOf.description: Generic primitive (any number of args with or without annotations)

micheline.location.title: Canonical location in a Micheline expression
micheline.location.description: The location of a node in a Micheline expression tree in prefix order, with zero being the root and adding one for every basic node, sequence and primitive application.

mutez.title: A millionth of a tez
mutez.description: One million mutez make a tez (1 tez = 1e6 mutez)

nanotez.title: A thousandth of a mutez
nanotez.description: One thousand nanotez make a mutez (1 tez = 1e9 nanotez)

network_version.description: A version number for the network protocol (includes distributed DB version and p2p version)

p2p_connection.id.description: The identifier for a p2p connection. It includes an address and a port number.

p2p_version.description: A version number for the p2p layer.

positive_bignum.title: Positive big number
positive_bignum.description: Decimal representation of a positive big number

sc_l2_message.description: A hex encoded smart rollup message

sc_rollup_l2_message_id.title: A smart rollup layer 2 message identifier (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_commitment_hash.title: The hash of a commitment of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_inbox_hash.title: The hash of an inbox of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_merkelized_payload_hashes_h.title: The hash of the Merkelized payload hashes of a smart rollup inbox (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_state_hash.title: The hash of the VM state of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

timestamp.protocol.description: A timestamp as seen by the protocol: second-level precision, epoch based.

timestamp.system.description: A timestamp as seen by the underlying, local computer: subsecond-level precision, epoch or rfc3339 based.

unistring.title: Universal string representation
unistring.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.
